subject: RE: [junit] [OT] coverage plugins for eclipse?
msgSnippet: ... I d only use hansel on classes that *have* full coverage, that is on classes where hansel shouldn t report failure. I agree that having unit tests failure
messageBody:
junit@yahoogroups.com wrote:
> Yes, in the ideal world, the numbers would be small, so
> "wading through them" to find the cause of the failure would
> be relatively trivial. Unfortunately, my world is not ideal,
> and there are lots of coverage failures and still some real
> failures. In order to focus on the real failures, instead of
> allowing people to hide behind the false belief (or wish)
> that the new failures are just coverage, we had to pull
> hansel out.

I'd only use hansel on classes that *have* full coverage, that is on classes
where hansel shouldn't report failure.

I agree that having unit tests failure that don't need to be immediately
fixed is suboptimal.

Cheers, Ilja
